page.title: 19GEOLOGY
page.content: The area has a variety of rock types. The oldest rocks, Devonian Old Red Sandstone, are found south of Aberthin village to Stalling Down. These are overlain by Carboniferous rocks mainly of grey crystalline limestone. These outcrop over a large area and have been quarried for building stone. There are no large quarries in the area. These are overlain unconformably by Mesozoic rocks and consist of breccias ,conglomerates, marls and limestones. These are found around Maendy, Prisk and to the north-west of Aberthin. Trerhyngyll rests entirely on Carboniferous limestone as does the TV mast at St.Hilary. The solid geology is partly hidden by Pleistocene sands and gravels deposited during the ice age and by Alluvium deposits of the River Thaw.
